title: The 11 teams that make the inaugural college football Impatience Index
content: CFP aspirations. Major investments. Too many losses. Fans are never patient, but these teams might have a right.

title: NCAA won't expand March Madness fields in '26
content: The fields for the men's and women's NCAA basketball tournaments will not be expanding this season, NCAA senior vice president of basketball Dan Gavitt announced.

title: Agent: Spurs, Fox reach $229M max extension
content: Spurs star De'Aaron Fox has agreed to a four-year, $229 million maximum contract extension with the franchise, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN.

title: Bills RB Cook, seeking extension, sits out again
content: Buffalo Bills running back James Cook did not participate in training camp practice for a second straight day on Monday as he continues to seek a contract extension.

title: Longhorns, Buckeyes top preseason coaches' poll
content: Texas, Ohio State, Penn State, Georgia and Notre Dame claimed the top five spots in the coaches' preseason top 25 poll released Monday.

title: Browns QB Sanders doesn't want Deion at camp
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders says he doesn't want his father, Deion, visiting training camp, because he wants to "get where I want to go" first. Sanders is the Browns only QB not to get first-team reps through the first week of training camp.

title: 'Shocked' Saquon declined Trump sports council
content: Eagles running back Saquon Barkley did not accept President Donald Trump's invitation to serve on his council on sports, fitness and nutrition, Barkley said Monday.

title: Falcons lock up Penix's blindside protector McGary
content: The Atlanta Falcons have locked up their right tackle position for the next few seasons, signing Kaleb McGary to a two-year extension, the team announced.

title: No US Open prep: Djokovic WDs from Cincy Open
content: Novak Djokovic pulled out of the Cincinnati Open on Monday for what officially was listed as a "non-medical" reason, meaning he will head to the US Open without having played a match in about 1½ months.

title: 🥳 Luka celebrates with Backstreet Boys concert
content: Doncic attended the concert in Las Vegas with his teammates and members of the Lakers front office, then met members of the band.

title: Buzz from NFL training camps: What we learned about the Packers, Ravens, Titans and 13 more teams
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including De'Aaron Fox, Spurs max extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: The team that absolutely cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: How the NL West was won? Why A.J. Preller's Padres went all-in at trade deadline
content: Inside the bold deals that showed San Diego means business as it chases the defending champion Dodgers.

title: Inside the winning formula that has Clemson poised for a championship run
content: With Cade Klubnik heading a large group of returnees, Dabo Swinney has Tigers fans thinking national title.

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: From Real Madrid to Man United, have last season's issues been fixed this summer?
content: There are several big clubs that regressed in a major way last season, including Real Madrid (no defense) and Man United (scoring goals). Have these 10 clubs done enough to fix those issues in the offseason?

title: Breaking down the FC 100: Which clubs were best represented? Who made the list for the 9th straight year?
content: While this year's FC 100 saw a staggering number of new faces, three stalwarts have made every edition of the rankings. Here's what else we learned from digging into the data.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and the Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: IND vs ENG: 57 minutes of hell! How India scripted a dramatic win at The Oval
content: At The Oval, India pulled off a stunning series draw against England after a nail-biting final hour. Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell and crucial wickets, including a final yorker to dismiss Chris Woakes, sealed the victory. Despite Woakes's courageous effort with a dislocated shoulder, India's persistence and strategic fielding led to wild celebrations and a memorable triumph.

title: 'Direct threat': Russia says 'no longer bound' by nuke treaty amid Trump's sub move
content: Russia has declared its withdrawal from the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty, citing security threats posed by Western actions, particularly the U.S. missile deployments. This decision follows the U.S. withdrawal in 2019 and accusations of treaty violations by both sides. The announcement escalates tensions amid warnings from both countries regarding nuclear rhetoric and potential conflict.

title: Mohammed Siraj gets emotional responding to Virat Kohli's message
content: India clinched a thrilling victory against England in the fifth Test, drawing the series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's exceptional bowling, claiming 5/104, was pivotal. Virat Kohli lauded the team's resilience, especially Siraj's dedication. Shubman Gill, named 'Player of the Series,' praised Siraj as a captain's dream, acknowledging his relentless effort.

title: Trump threatens more tariff saying India is reselling Russian oil
content: Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs on Indian exports, accusing India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and not caring about the Ukraine war. This action stems from India's refusal to concede to trade demands and its continued purchase of discounted Russian oil. The threat, combined with Trump's stance towards Pakistan, evokes historical parallels and risks impacting India's GDP growth.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet shares career advice she got from her father at 15: ‘You're never…’
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet attributes her success to a childhood lesson from her father: strive for excellence to be undeniable. This principle fueled her journey from a speech contest loss to leading a global consulting firm. Sweet emphasizes adaptability, echoing Jamie Dimon and Satya Nadella, as crucial for sustained growth and relevance in today's dynamic business landscape.

title: 'Not one ...': India's big message to US amid tensions over tariff, penalty threat
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar advocated for a fair and multipolar global order, emphasizing that it should not be dominated by a select few nations. Speaking at the BIMSTEC Traditional Music Festival, he highlighted the role of cultural traditions in strengthening national identity and guiding national direction. Jaishankar's remarks come amid global trade tensions and diplomatic challenges for India.

title: Trump's Putin problem - US can't sway India, China on Russia oil - what's next
content: Donald Trump's efforts to pressure Russia through China and India regarding the Russia-Ukraine war are faltering, as both nations resist halting Russian oil imports despite threats of tariffs. China asserts its energy independence, while India emphasizes its long-standing partnership with Russia.

title: From Shubman to Virat: How India's top captains fared on their first England tour
content: This article examines the inaugural Test tours of England for five Indian captains, highlighting their varying degrees of success. Shubman Gill's impressive 754 runs and series-levelling leadership in his recent tour stand out. In contrast, MS Dhoni faced a 0-4 whitewash in 2011, while Sourav Ganguly secured a commendable 1-1 draw in 2002.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in the US are 'made' in India
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‘I think we have to....'
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: Carter Hart’s NHL future in limbo: Insider blasts return rumors; Hockey Canada verdict fallout
content: The future of Carter Hart in the NHL is unclear. This is despite his acquittal in the Hockey Canada case. NHL insider Elliotte Friedman advises against speculation. The league will review the judge's findings before deciding on eligibility. Teams like the Edmonton Oilers are wary of the public relations risk.

title: Foul play? Sunjay Kapur's mother makes shock claim; asks UK to probe 'mysterious' death
content: Sunjay Kapur's death in London sparks a global investigation. Rani Kapur, his mother, alleges foul play and seeks a UK probe. US authorities are monitoring the case. A family feud with Sona Comstar intensifies. Rani Kapur claims coercion and mismanagement. Sona Comstar denies the allegations. Legal battles are ongoing. The dispute involves family legacy and corporate control.

title: 'Sab sikhaana padta hai bowling ko chhod ke': Arshdeep Singh trolls Mohammed Siraj
content: Following India's thrilling victory over England, Mohammed Siraj found himself facing a different challenge off the field. Arshdeep Singh playfully coaxed Siraj into filming a quick Instagram reel, repeating the popular catchphrase, “Pressure? What pressure?”. Despite his initial confusion, Siraj obliged, capturing the team's light-hearted mood after their hard-fought win.

title: Brooke Hogan’s husband slams Hulk Hogan: No effort to meet grandkids — “There was no interest”
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: Dak Prescott builds new mansion, reveals why he razed the last one
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott is rebuilding his Texas mansion in Prosper, aiming for a more contemporary and intimate design. Construction began after he demolished his previous multi-million-dollar estate in October 2024. The new structure, featuring clean lines and compartmentalized segments, appears to be a luxurious, multi-story residence.

title: Taylor Swift nears Chiefs ownership: Kelce jacket inspires NFL line; football meets fashion
content: Kristin Juszczyk, the designer, is launching a new NFL collection. This follows Taylor Swift's viral moment in a custom jacket. The collection celebrates fan culture and team loyalty. It features Chiefs-themed items like corsets and tees. Juszczyk acknowledges the support from Chiefs Kingdom. She credits Swift and Brittany Mahomes for boosting her career.

title: Colon cancer: Rapid surge in young adults; US Gastroenterologist recommends 4 fruits
content: Recent studies highlight a concerning rise in colon cancer among younger adults, prompting experts to emphasize preventive lifestyle changes. Consuming fruits like watermelon, apples, kiwi, and citrus, rich in fiber and antioxidants, can significantly reduce the risk. Alongside a plant-rich diet, regular exercise, weight management, and limited alcohol intake are crucial for prevention.

title: Laura Govan sends a heart emoji to NFL star Cam Ward's emotional story
content: Laura Govan, ex of Gilbert Arenas, supports young athletes inspired by their fathers. She commented on Cam Ward's story about his father's work ethic. Govan's four children with Arenas are all involved in basketball. Izela plays for Louisville, and Alijah is committed to USC. Hamiley started playing in high school, and Aloni gained fame online.

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' — motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: What Harvard’s $500M rejection signals for the future of US higher education
content: Harvard University has rejected a $500 million federal settlement, sparking a major conflict over academic freedom. The university is challenging political directives related to diversity and admissions, potentially setting a precedent for other institutions. This decision highlights the ongoing debate about the control and values within American higher education, impacting students and scholars nationwide.

title: Mohammed Siraj: A warrior, who never stopped believing
content: Mohammed Siraj isn’t just a fast bowler; he’s India’s beating heart in whites. At The Oval, with his relentless spirit, he rose when it mattered most, turning belief into brilliance, sealing a memorable win, and putting a smile on the faces of 1.4 billion people back home.

title: Cardiologist explains how to correctly measure blood pressure at home
content: Accurate blood pressure readings are crucial for health management. Incorrect techniques can lead to skewed results, potentially misdiagnosing hypertension or prompting unnecessary medication adjustments. Following proper guidelines, such as correct posture, arm support, cuff size, and multiple readings, ensures reliable measurements. Regular monitoring and device verification with a doctor are also recommended.

title: Virat Kohli's powerful words for Siraj: 'He'll give everything for the team'
content: India clinched a nail-biting six-run victory over England in the fifth Test at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's sensational spell of 5 for 104, including a crucial 3 for 9 on the final day, spearheaded India's fightback. Virat Kohli lauded Siraj's resilience, highlighting his commitment to the team.

title: Mohammed Siraj seals thriller as India win Oval Test by 6 runs; draw series 2-2
content: India secured a thrilling 6-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, clinching the series. Mohammed Siraj's exceptional bowling performance, claiming five wickets, including three crucial dismissals on the final morning, turned the tide after England's strong start. Despite Joe Root and Harry Brook's centuries, India's unwavering belief and Siraj's heroics sealed the unforgettable win.

title: 'I gave him salaam, he slapped me': Flyer roughed up on IndiGo flight shares ordeal
content: Hoosain Ahmed Mazumdar, assaulted on an IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Kolkata, returned home after a harrowing 48 hours. His family accuses IndiGo of negligence, citing a lack of communication regarding his whereabouts after the incident. Mazumdar, a gym cleaner, was allegedly attacked by a co-passenger, Hafizur Rahman, mid-flight.

title: IND vs ENG: 'We will never surrender' - Gambhir's fiery message after India level series 2-2
content: India clinched a thrilling six-run victory over England in the final Test at The Oval, levelling the series 2-2. Coach Gautam Gambhir lauded the team's unwavering spirit, emphasizing their refusal to surrender. Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance, including the final, decisive wicket, fueled India's comeback after a shaky start. The emotional win showcased the team's unity and resilience under pressure.

title: US unveils new visa rules: Some visitors may pay $15,000 bond under Trump policy
content: The Donald Trump administration is reviving a policy requiring visitors from countries with high visa overstay rates to pay bonds up to $15,000 for B-1 and B-2 visas. This year-long pilot program aims to ensure visitors depart on time.

title: Dennis Rodman’s daughter Trinity praised by Magic Johnson: Lakers legend lauds latest achievement
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: 'Be very cautious': Kremlin's warning to Trump over 'nuclear rhetoric'
content: The Kremlin has urged caution following Donald Trump's announcement of deploying two nuclear submarines closer to Russia. This action was a response to Dmitry Medvedev's provocative statements regarding nuclear capabilities. Trump emphasized the deployment as a precaution, highlighting the US's readiness to protect its people amidst escalating tensions and potential new sanctions against Russia.

title: Flat tyre grounds IndiGo flight in Jabalpur; spare flown in from Delhi, delays stretch over 4 hours
content: An IndiGo flight, 6E 792 from Jabalpur to Mumbai, faced a significant delay of over four hours on Monday due to a flat tyre. The Airbus A320 (VT-IFS) experienced the issue during a pre-flight inspection in Jabalpur. To ensure safety, the airline decided to replace the tyre, airlifting a spare from Delhi.

title: After SC rap, BJP corners Rahul: Questions stand on security - says be careful
content: Following Supreme Court's criticism of Rahul Gandhi's remarks about the Indian Army, the BJP has launched a strong attack, questioning his loyalty to the nation. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia suggested Gandhi's statements might be aiding enemy nations and demoralizing the armed forces.

title: IND vs ENG: Siraj reveals Ronaldo inspired his Day 5 heroics – Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's remarkable turnaround fueled India's dramatic victory at The Oval. Overcoming disappointment from a previous match, Siraj drew inspiration from Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Believe' mantra, even setting it as his phone wallpaper. His five-wicket haul, driven by dedication to his country, leveled the series. Captain Gill praised Siraj's exceptional skill with the old ball.

title: Cong ignores SC rap, doubles down on China claim; takes 'DDLJ' jab at Centre
content: The Supreme Court's criticism of Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the India-China border standoff has ignited a political firestorm. The BJP has accused Gandhi of being "anti-national" and undermining national security, citing his comments on Chinese incursions.

title: Delhi moves to regulate private school fees; Sood slams 'mafias', says education isn't for sale
content: Delhi government proposes a bill to control private school fees. The move follows protests over fee hikes. Many schools increased fees significantly, burdening parents. The bill seeks to ensure transparency and prevent commercialization. It includes penalties for schools violating regulations. It also establishes a grievance system for parents. The bill aims to balance regulation and school autonomy.

title: IND vs ENG: 'They panicked' - Michael Vuaghan lambasts England's approach vs India
content: Michael Vaughan has critiqued England's aggressive tactics in the Oval Test, suggesting panic contributed to their collapse against India. Despite acknowledging the entertainment value of their approach, Vaughan pinpointed Harry Brook's dismissal as a turning point. India's dramatic victory, highlighted by Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance, leveled the series, concluding a hard-fought contest.

title: Mohammed Siraj in tears as India pull off miracle win at The Oval - Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's sensational bowling performance led India to a thrilling six-run victory over England in the fifth Test at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Siraj's nine wickets in the match, including a crucial five-wicket haul in the second innings, turned the tide as England were close to winning on the final day.

title: 'Not young, but gun': Shubman Gill reveals Gambhir's fired-up mantra
content: Shubman Gill was named India’s ‘Player of the Series’ after scoring 754 runs, which included four centuries. His standout performances included scores of 147 in Leeds, 269 and 161 in Birmingham, and 103 in Manchester.

title: Deion Sanders breaks silence after keeping cancer a secret from sons
content: Deion Sanders battled bladder cancer privately this year. He kept it from his sons, Shedeur and Shilo, to avoid distracting them from their football goals. Sanders underwent successful surgery and is now cancer-free. His sons are currently pursuing NFL careers. Shedeur is at Cleveland Browns training camp. Shilo joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Breakup ke baad bhi dukh hota hai' - Siraj opens up after topsy-turvy series
content: Mohammed Siraj's exceptional performance, highlighted by a crucial final-day spell, secured India's thrilling six-run victory against England, leveling the series 2-2. HIs decisive dismissal of Gus Atkinson with a searing yorker, showcased his resilience and determination. Despite earlier setbacks, Siraj's unwavering belief and fiery spirit propelled India to a memorable win at The Oval.

title: Do not politicise my meeting with Stalin, says O. Panneerselvam
content: In a statement, he terms as “indecent” the attempts by some to paint his visit to the Chief Minister’s residence in a political light

title: Will not interfere in Madras High Court order against DMK membership drive, says Supreme Court
content: The case pertains to the DMK collecting mobile numbers from the people as part of its Oraniyil Tamil Nadu drive

title: India’s marine fish landings drop 2% in 2024: CMFRI
content: Gujarat retained its top position in overall fish landings with 7.54 lakh tonnes, followed by Tamil Nadu (6.79 lakh tonnes)

title: Rights group blames J&K Police for backlash against Kashmiris after Pahalgam attack
content: The forum said the police provided “hasty and incorrect information” that triggered “hate speech and hateful actions against Kashmiris”

title: Amit Shah holds meet with West Bengal MPs, kick-starts poll preparations
content: Special Intensive Revision of voter list and seats reserved for Scheduled Castes and Tribes come in for special mention

title: Army Chief Hails Operation Sindoor as landmark in India’s counter-terrorism doctrine
content: At an event in IIT Madras, he says 88-hour operation was unprecedented in scale, range, depth, and strategic impact, and was executed across the DIME spectrum

title: SC questions U.P.’s use of ordinance to take control of Banke Bihari temple
content: Justice Surya Kant expressed disapproval of the clandestine manner employed to secure the court’s permission in getting a judgment on May 15 by filing a civil dispute to use temple funds to develop the Shri Banke Bihari Temple Corridor project

title: Defence panel reviews women’s role; Rajnath vows greater representation
content: Defence officials highlight expanding opportunities for women across all three armed services as Centre gives commitment to facilitate greater inclusion

title: RTC strike to go ahead from Tuesday despite High Court direction: JAC
content: A final round of talks was held on Monday between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy, and representatives of the employees’ union, but the discussions ended without a resolution.

title: BJP leader Amit Malviya’s ‘no language called Bengali’ jibe sparks outrage, leaves Trinamool fuming
content: The Trinamool Congress accused the BJP of ‘systematically promoting xenophobia and othering, with Bengalis being deliberately targeted across States’

title: Operation Sindoor and Chenab Bridge to feature on Independence Day invites
content: Independence Day invites from the Ministry of Defence for this year’s Independence Day celebrations will have Operation Sindoor as the central theme

title: Bihar leaders find SIR draft rolls ‘difficult’ to compare
content: While the Election Commission has said that no political party in the State has filed an objection, the Opposition parties allege that the poll body has “deliberately” made comparison of current and earlier rolls complicated

title: Trade unions, farm outfits demand parliamentary approval of trade treaties
content: CTUs and SKM urge the Centre to reject U.S. tariffs, uphold sovereignty of India; in joint statement, they say ‘East India Company colonised India through trade and today, CETA and U.S. trade deals are the new instruments of corporate imperialism’

title: Pollution Control Boards have power to impose restitutionary damages under Water, Air Acts, says Supreme Court
content: The aim is to completely restore polluted air and waterbodies back to their original, pristine selves in an ecosystem, says Bench

title: PM's Pariksha Pe Charcha Sets Guinness World Record For Most Registrations In A Month
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Pariksha Pe Charcha initiative has entered the Guinness World Record for "most people registered on a citizen engagement platform in one month", the Ministry of Education (MoE) announced on Monday.

title: 15 Militants Arrested; Arms, Cache Of Ammunition Recovered In Manipur
content: In a sustained series of operations, the Army and Assam Rifles units in close coordination with Manipur Police and other security forces arrested 15 active insurgent cadres and recovered 69 weapons

title: Mizoram Government Denies Allegations Of Shifting State Capital From Aizawl to Thenzawl
content: The Mizoram government on Monday denied the allegation that it has been trying to shift the state capital from Aizawl to Thenzawl in Serchhip district.

title: Pregnant Woman Sent With Gauze Inside After Surgery; Loses Uterus
content: A private hospital here is under probe for allegedly leaving a gauze inside a woman's stomach, which caused her uterus to be removed, according to the chief medical officer.

title: "Certified Anti-National": BJP After Top Court Raps Rahul Gandhi Over Army Remarks
content: As the Supreme Court slammed Rahul Gandhi over his remarks about the Indian Army, the BJP on Monday tore into the Congress leader and alleged that he has vowed to "weaken India and strengthen China".

title: Visa Applicants May Need To Post Bond Of Up To $15,000 To Enter US
content: The State Department is proposing requiring applicants for business and tourist visas to post a bond of up to $15,000 to enter the United States, a move that may make the process unaffordable for many.

title: Trans Person Found With Throat Slit Under Delhi Bridge, Minor Detained: Cops
content: A transperson was found with her throat slit under a bridge in east Delhi's Madhu Vihar area on Monday afternoon, and a minor was caught at the scene who claimed that her ex-husband carried out the murder, officials said.

title: K Kavitha's 72-Hour Fast Ends On Day 1 After High Court Order
content: K Kavitha - MLC of Bharat Rashtra Samithi and president of Telangana Jagruti -- ended her proposed 72-hour hunger strike to demand 42 per cent quota for backward classes, on Day One following court orders.

title: "Forgotten His Roots": BJP Seeks Kamal Haasan's Apology Over Sanatana Remark
content: The Tamil Nadu unit of the BJP has launched a sharp attack on actor-politician Kamal Haasan, demanding an unconditional apology for his remarks on Sanatana Dharma.

title: Probe Agency Arrests Conversion Gang Mastermind Chhangur Baba's Aide
content: A special PMLA court in Lucknow granted custody of Naveen Rohra, an alleged aide of Chhangur Baba, to the ED as part of a money-laundering investigation linked to an alleged illegal religious conversion racket in Uttar Pradesh, official sources said.

title: "This Is The New Trend": Top Court On "Affluent Persons" Approaching It Directly
content: The Supreme Court censured the practice of affluent persons coming to it directly seeking reliefs in criminal cases as it asked Bhupesh Baghel and his son to go to the high court in cases probed by central investigating agencies.

title: Vietnamese EV Major Rolls Out Electric SUVs At Its Tamil Nadu Plant
content: Vietnamese Electric Vehicle major VinFast  formally rolled out its first electric SUVs - VF6 and VF7 - from its 400-acre manufacturing facility in Tuticorin.

title: 3 Women Allege Harassment By Cops During Missing Person's Probe In Pune
content: Three women living in Pune have alleged that police personnel physically harassed them and made casteist remarks during a probe related to a woman, reported missing from Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, who stayed with them briefly.

title: Bones Found From New Site In Dharmasthala Mass Burial Case
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the alleged mass burial case in Dharmasthala on Monday recovered multiple skeletal remains from a new site identified by the anonymous complainant, police sources said.

title: Ajith Kumar Marks 33 Years in Cinema, Racing With Heartfelt Tribute And Big Motorsport Feat
content: Tamil cinema icon and motorsport enthusiast S Ajith Kumar has penned an emotional letter marking 33 years of his extraordinary journey in films and racing, describing it as a story of perseverance, gratitude, and purpose.

title: 6 Cubs Born To Royal Bengal Tiger In Delhi Zoo, Largest Litter In 20 Years
content: The Delhi Zoo on Monday celebrated the birth of six Bengal Tiger cubs -- the biggest litter recorded at the facility in the last two decades.

title: Punjab Panchayats Oppose Same-Village Marriages, Cite Violent Disputes, Family Feuds
content: Some gram panchayats in Punjab are mounting stiff resistance to love marriages, especially if the couple hails from the same village.

title: One Tunnel Left, Delhi's Pragati Maidan Project Inches Closer to Completion
content: After months of waiting and repeated delays, the final underpass in the Pragati Maidan tunnel network has finally received the go-ahead.

title: UP Family Drops Man's Body From Moving Ambulance, Tries To Block Highway
content: Days after a man died during a dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district, his family members dropped his body from an ambulance and attempted to block the national highway.

title: Modi likely to take ride on Yellow Line metro, launch Vande Bharat to Belagavi
content: The Karnataka unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party is leaving no stone unturned to turn the twin inaugurations into a high-profile occasion.

title: Kerala HC dismisses habeas corpus petition after woman appears before court
content: The petitioner claimed that he had married the woman, who was traced by the police at Maradu in Kochi, in 2022 after meeting her through a matrimonial website

title: Nitish Kumar announces domicile policy, new welfare schemes in Bihar
content: The new policy will apply from the Teachers Recruitment Examination-4 in 2025 onward; only Bihar residents will now be eligible for government teaching positions under this policy

title: PM Modi to address NDA Parliamentary Party meeting on August 5
content: The Prime Minister is also likely to be felicitated by the parliamentary party over his government's military response to the terror strike

title: Producer Sandra Thomas to take legal recourse after rejection of nominations for KFPA office-bearer election
content: She alleges that returning officer acted at the behest of a few persons who have been controlling the apex body of producers for long

title: Bombay High Court says ‘No’ to contempt proceedings against CPI(M)
content: The party has publicly criticised the court’s recent observations while rejecting its plea to hold a protest in support of Gaza

title: Karnataka Health Department brings AYUSH medicines, testing labs under FSDA purview
content: ‘Move is to control the quality of medicines being prescribed under the alternative systems of medicine, especially as their consumption continues to rise among the public’

title: Commission report on Kaleshwaram will be tabled in the Assembly to decide future course of action: CM
content: Revanth Reddy says former chief minister K. Chandrashekhar Rao can share his views on the report in the Assembly

title: Commuters frustrated as Namma Metro’s Yellow Line set to open without adequate trains
content: Officials at the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) admitted that the line will not operate at full capacity immediately due to a shortage of trains.

title: Fans furious over constant dillydallying over Messi’s visit to Kerala
content: Itinerary released in May omitted Kerala stop, contradicting earlier announcement that Messi-led Argentina would play two exhibition matches in 2025

title: T.P. murder case accused Rajeesh granted parole amid controversy over Kodi Suni
content: Suni and his associates were caught on camera drinking while in custody.  P. Jayarajan defends the decision to grant parole to Rajeesh

title: Be conscious of public health, Naidu tells officials ahead of new liquor policy launch
content: Do not look at it merely from the revenue generation perspective, says Chandrababu Naidu during a review on the policy coming into effect from September 1

title: Submit proposal for breast milk bank to reduce infant mortality, directs Mandya CEO
content: She says infant mortality can be reduced by providing safely collected breast milk from donor mothers to babies who lack access to their own mother’s milk

title: Memorial for Tondaiman king and museum coming up in Pudukottai
content: The memorial coming up at an estimate of ₹3.02 crore on an area measuring 760.50 square metres will have museum which will display articles used by the late king

title: West Bengal CM accuses Damodar Valley Corporation of ‘anti-Bengal conspiracy’, triggering floods
content: Mamata Banerjee also says she suspects a deeper conspiracy behind its release of water, and the consequent damage caused to infrastructure, agriculture and livelihoods across districts due to flood-like situations

title: Allegation of stray dog culling prompts police to search waste treatment plant in Munnar
content: Animal welfare activists say 200 dogs were culled. Munnar panchayat refutes allegations. Environmentalist says panchayat authorities shifted the dog carcasses from the plant ahead of the search. Search yields four carcasses.

title: Social Welfare Dept. employee dies in Shivamogga
content: Suresh, 57, who was posted at the post-metric hostel of the department at Gadikoppa in Shivamogga, allegedly attempted to end his life on July 31. He was admitted to McGann Hospital in the city, where he died on Monday

title: What would Cowboys' pass rush look like without Micah Parsons?

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .
